body:

replies.body:
We don't currently have definitive plans to make marksmen less necessary. I know players seem to want this, but it's actually not clear to me exactly how they want it.

For instance, they could want this so that they can lane less traditional champions in a duo lane. They could want us to make a large number of other characters really powerful turret killers. They could want a bunch sustained physical damage casters (like physical damage Karthus or something). Or it could be any of a number of other reasons.

Basically, it's unclear, to me at least, why exactly it's more ideal for marksmen to be less important. This may not be the perfect example, but football teams have quarterbacks on every team, and that seems to be perfectly satisfactory there.

For what it's worth, I'm not saying I personally think it wouldn't be be more interesting if marksmen were less necessary. I'm just not sure I understand what the intended outcome is, and why that outcome is more desirable.

Because it's the only class of champions in which that is the case.

You always need a top/mid/jungle/support, yes, but those could be of varying champion class. Mid can be mages or assassins, top lane can be fighters or tanks, supports could be pure supports or tanks, jungle can be basically everything. Meanwhile, the 'farming role in bot lane' is always a marksman (unless it's Morde.)

This is the opinion I expected to hear from most people on this subject, and the one that I personally resonate pretty strongly with.

To me personally, I don't necessarily have an issue with marksmen except for their relative monopoly over the duo lane carry position. It's possible that this would be meaningfully alleviated to me if marksmen didn't feel so "same-y" to play as/against (I know there are ad mains out there that will disagree wholly with this).

That said, the idea of bringing your tank, mage, or fighter as a duo lane farmer is definitely an exciting prospect, though I think we're a long way from that at the moment.

>That said, the idea of bringing your tank, mage, or fighter as a duo lane farmer is definitely an exciting prospect, though I think we're a long way from that at the moment.

I know this is going to be controversial to say, but I think Morde is the prime prototype of what could possibly be. To be honest, I'm not sure the juggernaut rework was a success and I honestly think a new champion should have been introduced instead, but this can serve as a learning experience for future (and hopefully more successful) attempts.

The problem with Morde, imo, is that he's either useless or overbearing in the bot lane. The exp passive is rather tacked on I feel, but I feel like a similar mechanic can work in the future with the same goal: teamwork.

Basically, marksman are kind of weak on their own early game, but are strong when partnered with a support. Sure, it's easier to land skillshots when the enemy is cc'd by any class, but champions like Draven or Vayne get the most "oomph" out of it. I think that can be applied to future champions of any class, designed around having a partner early game and team orientated late-game just like ADC's, but not turned into another utility mage or tank that goes bot lane. Maybe something like a champion that can chain cc with other champions (not themselves), or naturally reduces critical damage, or whatever else.

I feel like it is possible. If ADC's can go top lane, sometimes mid, and nowadays even jungle, I think it's time we accept that *some* of them are capable of solo laning, and make it so bot lane is more accessible instead of just booting ADC's out of the game. Not that I'm accusing you guys of anything.

> the goal of the balance is to make everyone not picked 100%

The goal of balance is to ensure the game is welcoming to many different styles of play, at its core.  Pickrates have very little to do with it, especially in cases like Thresh (very popular but not the highest winrate/impact support), other than extreme outliers like the Zed example you mentioned.

Balancing around rough win rate isn't actually the goal, it just happens to be one of the byproducts of effective balancing.  A great example of this is Azir; his win rate is *horrible* if viewing the entire playerbase (less than 45%), but if you only look at people that are super dedicated to the champion his win rate becomes extremely high (greater than 55%).

> isn't your role to balance it so we can all pick what we want?

This is a complicated question.  One of the goals of balance is to make sure lots of strategies are viable, sure, but at the same time it's very difficult to have compelling gameplay if the game is balanced around "you can play anyone anywhere".  Champions have distinct strengths and weaknesses, and it's this imbalance that actually makes League of Legends so much fun.  

Jax, for example, excels at dueling, and that's basically his entire identity.  Would it be within the game's best interest to weaken that identity in order to allow him to duo lane, or should Jax stay unique in his role and excel where he was designed to?  Tryndamere is an extremely strong 1v1 tower diver and splitpusher, should he be homogenized so that he can also do acceptably in a duo lane?

Mocking Shout still removes 80 AD (down from 100), slows for 4 seconds (down from 5), and a lot of other parts of his kit were buffed.

>He is know a splitpusher because riot nerfed his utility and base stats along with his heal (from 400 to 300) and his crit damage, so they nerfed him and he is only playable as a splitpusher

They nerfed his slow from being the single longest duration slow in the game to being tied for the longest duration slow in the game, and lowered the AD cut by 20%.  They also buffed his base stats numerous times with one small nerf to them in early 2012, and his crit damage has remained completely unchanged.  

He is best played as a splitpusher because he's an absolute monster at taking down turrets and can dive a lone defender extremely easily, which is why him being top alone generally forces 2+ enemy teammates to deal with him.

Think Azir in this, not Cassiopeia. Someone high range that isn't gated by cooldowns very much. It would also allow more AD mid laners in more team compositions. I personally have played Azir as an ADC in the bottom lane because my team had very little magic damage, and it worked out pretty well.

I played Cassiopeia bot lane to fulfil the rework's dream of her having a "marksman" power curve and it was really fun up until the mana refund nerf - now she doesn't have enough mana to kill someone in lane, given the fact her costs also went up in one of the previous patches. So far as I can identify, it's less about the power curve and more about having the resource management to survive duelling an auto-attacker - either you need the combo to do it once and win the lane, or the sustain to hack away and not be pushed out from one combo. If the game ever goes long enough for the opposing carry to get 5+items, or if your lead ever diminishes to a point where you no longer clearly win open fights around drake/baron, you simply loose. An 5item adc is a superior force in any fight unless you manage to get a great flank and instantly take him out, and siegeing down towers is really hard, even with champs like ziggs, if you don't have an adc.
If you loose a fight vs jinx after the 40min mark, you can be assured that most off your base is gone afterwards, if you loose it to a no-adc, maybe one tower will fall...

Not only is their major damage point n click and rng-based, it also means that leategame, you have not akot difference between how they play, other than positioning with mobillity/range differences.
A graves come lategame will do more damage with a singl crit than he does with his ult, and i wish that was overexaggerated, but it isn't.
The destinct kits, especially for more caster based carrys, falls totally short come to lategame, as it's all about the rightclick-rng.

The problem is, that Marksmen are in 100% of the games (except when Mord is not banned)
That means we need AP mid laners. You can't go AD mid if you don't have AP top, or you'll get flamed by your team, because we are now full AD comp, and ff@20 spam.
Why can you pick Marksmen in every single game and it's ok, but you can't pick AD mids? That's the problem, some champions are viable in 100% of the games, and others are left for sometimes.
So either give us more gold and easier clears in jungle, so we can pick our favorite assassins there, or make AP bot laners viable.

TLDR
Some champions can be viably picked in every single game, while others cannot, due to the team comp/team harass. That is discrimination.

I think an ultimate goal expands from 'Marksman  Update'. The outcome I'd want asks for radical change. Radical change needs to be prepared and accepted in avid LoL players (propaganda still works today).

Starting with Marksmen I suppose _may_ be a first-step though the radical suggestion I preach requires all 'balance changes' to weave a focus to the ultimate redevelopment. I have no idea what's been focused upon over 6 years but it's about time something was made clear: A CLEAR LONG-TERM VISION FOR A CONSISTENT & STABLE PRODUCT.

1. If Kit were made more important than Items **(Kit > Items)**:
 * **Simplified Items:** Abilities come strictly from Kit and not from Items (Items become 'salt & pepper' instead of a 'side order'). Items will not allow for significant unique abilities like Actives (e.g. Zhonya's).
In redevelopment, Item's role would simply become steroids reflecting team's progression without adverse effects against enemy. Adversity comes from player's and team's ability to perform extraordinarily. Dependency on Item's decreased; Reliance on player activity is increased.
 _(I understand this may not make sense. It's a radical suggestion)_  
  * **Equalizer Items:** Champion compositions made less incompatible _with_ or _against_ each other as Items are repurposed for seemingly poor champion compositions (Kit) made bearable in almost any match (Items). Versatility.
Intended things: confidence in team comp. and champ-select, and clarifying item decisions: For Me, For Team, ~~For Both~~.
 * **Defined Roles:** With Kits becoming the priority their roles are refined. The _excessive_ learning of the this game is reduced from which players will excel quicker and further. These  Kits offer _clear_ options at champ-select: pre-game becomes easier, quicker and with confidence!
2. If Items were made more important than Kit **(Items > Kit)**:
 * **Kit Value:** Redundancy may happen when Items continue to show more importance than Kit. This sounds like old ADC, doesn't it? Confidence in champion-select becomes difficult when Items builds manipulate too much.
  The excess here causes several problems, I think. Kits may offer advantages allowing Items to work better but why should we think so hard about these when most of the gameplay is about combat, tactics and strategy? More thinking; less playing: Kit is not enough. Imagine trying to walk in quicksand. This is LoL.
 * **Last Hit:** Game is to destroy the Nexus by having control over lanes. Not last hit monotony. Item dependency falls onto Gold Income and Last Hit dependency. Last Hit is inconsistent in all parts of the game and causes tension against strong champ-counters. Even the guessing part when to right-click is _so_ fucking frustrating. Current system may remain for what it may do ..but updated to keep both teams equally competitive through-out entire match (Item purchases happen at relatively same time between teams).
 * **Chaos Theory:** Hemorrhage. Where confidence in a decision and action should deliver it is constantly tested or inhibited instead. Why? [Too much stuff going on](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/ptf7T0AA-riots-not-being-fair-with-their-balancing?comment=0005), maybe?

___
___


Like with Black Market Brawlers, as a separate game-type we could have Items with outstanding effects. This way, the _real_ game is kept fair and tolerant while the other game-type is there for people to just 'over-indulge' peaking those fun levels. Though this segregates casual and genuine players they are both appeased. In my mind, it would also form cohesion between 'pro' and 'real' players. **This additional idea puts this post's message into perspective**.

Two game-types: **Normal **&** Gravy**.

 * [**Normal** gametype]: After many changes including Items, 'normal' game is defined and sanitized. (Fair Game; Kits)
 * [**Gravy** gametype]: On top of a redeveloped game, insanity is kept with additional excessive old and new crazy items. (Fun Game; Items)

I'm feeling a little lazy, so hear is copy-pasta of my thoughts on ADC from about a month ago that I think is quite relevant.

People complain about ADC's being weak right now (sans Vayne), but clearly they are still the dominant force in the league. They are the only champion class or itemization that each team has a minimum of one of. Bot lane itself is stagnant and boring, and I'd love to see change.

Kindred is one direction to take towards making more options bot lane, although I'd really like to see changes to make ADC's less of a necessity overall in the first place.

Even when ADC's are a class feel really unfun and boring (Right now, for the most part), so as long as they are a necessity for a functional team they are overpowered; No other class is irreplaceable or essential.

Right now, ADC's serve two irreplaceable purposes - to force enemies to build armor, as HP alone is not enough to tank ADC's but is usually enough against bruisers and AD assassins, and to take defended towers safely. Neither of these are particularly satisfying elements of play for an ADC, but so as long as no one else can do it, this ends up being their primary point of balance.

If these were no longer an essential parts of a functional team regardless of strategy, like if Ohm Wrecker became a real item for sieging towers, or with more effective physical DPS options for assassins and bruisers (I think the Juggernauts are awesome because they fill this niche) ADC's could have real differences in play style and itemization, rather than building and playing for more or less identical tower-taking and tank-busting roles.

As far as Ohm Wrecker goes, I think it needs to be oriented towards mid to late game 5 man tower dives. It shouldn't be "that item that junglers rush to dive towers early game" but an item for late game 5 man dives for towers defended by ranged wave clear. I'd love to get involved in a conversation of how to accomplish this.

i wonder how dota 2 makes carry different and viable without making crit mandatory. Literally only 2 or 3 champs buy IE in dota 2, after 2 years i don't know how.

Carries can get a ton of base damage from their kit, and the form of that base damage may work best with non-crit damage stroids. You will see that many carries who get straight autoattack damage from their kit still buy daedalus very regularly. Carries also have to buy tank items in dota. A carry can easily put out half their team's damage while also being impossible to kill. That would not be allowed in league unless it was someone extremely immobile like darius.

Its more of the fact that Ranged ADC's are REQUIRED after a certain skill level in the game. They bring ranged siege damage while having extremely high single target damage themselves.  This is mainly in part of the fact that VERY few classes generally have access to the same siege potential, either because of safety reasons or lack of options for it. Banner, Ohmwrecker, and Portal all were to help with this, but end up being lack luster because of them not being efficient on many champions. Even the classes that have access to similar siege potential, dont offer the single target damage RADC's do. Marksmen as they are called just give so much in one package for high level play in the current game.

It becomes stale and boring very quickly, which is why I think people are asking for them to become less necessary. I used to play bot lane constantly, but I stopped because it got VERY boring.

If you look at the Meddler thread, the only solution they have for that is RNG based crits. Because if you don't have that random factor decide the game for you every once in a while then why even play? You would already know the outcome since its so predictable.

What that tells me is that people are too used to RNG crits. Dota carries dont NEED crit to carry. HoTS carries dont either. Other mobas have either gotten rid of crit, or made it OPTIONAL. In league, it isnt optional as a carry. If you dont have crit, you have at most half the dps of the carry who does.  And yes, Crit exists in DoTA. But do you see every carry in the game rushing that big crit item in DoTA? Nope. You see them get it late game. There are other options for DPS than crit, something league lacks in dump truck loads for carries.

I think you should make it harder for AD champions to take towers, especially in the early game. As it is now, if you get killed bot lane by a jinx or trist, your tower's gone. If you get ganked top lane and die to an ad top laner and jungle, your tower is gone. Late game any AD champ can take a tower before anything meaningful can happen while your team lacks their main damage dealer. 

Personally I don't find the marksman role to be mandatory. I've done just fine with an APC paired with a support when my team's gone a bit crazy with the ad top, mid, and jungle. The issue is that everyone else does and that's where you lose the variety. There's definitely more duo lane combinations than just support + adc, people just don't want to give them a chance outside of goofing off in normals.

Imagine making even more carries like Morde that rely on their allies. The balance team's current response to high vitality, aggressive champions is to nerf them. But why not buff marksmen? Not so they can compete with a Maokai+Mordekaiser bot lane, but so they can take their farm game to top lane: defensive options that are basically limited to avoiding ganks and avoiding 1 shots. The whole result of this theory crafting is earlier, more fun teamfights and an even stronger reinforcement of top lane as an island - where farm reliant carries can just farm- and ADs as lategame turret takers.
